      • getBiggestTask

        public dTask getBiggestTask()
        returns the biggest task. I think this was never used in the final implementation. A clear example of censoring through the Control System. Tasks beyond the range of the tanker and task more than the current water level is censored.
        Returns:
        the biggest task explored

      • getBiggestTask

        public dTask getBiggestTask(int waterlevel)

      • getNearestTask

        public dTask getNearestTask()
        returns the nearest task. A clear example of censoring through the Control System. Tasks beyond the range of the tanker and task more than the current water level is censored.
        Returns:
        the nearest task explored

      • getNearestWell

        public dWell getNearestWell()
        returns the nearest well from the tanker. A clear example of censoring through the Control System. Wells beyond the range of the tanker is censored. This lead to a bug where the tanker does not see any wells that are within its reach. The alternative will be trying to get the nearest well from the fuel pump, hence leading the tanker back to the fuel pump and to the well. Else there's need to do mnore exploration
        Returns:
        the nearest well explored

      • getOutput

        public uk.ac.nott.cs.g54dia.library.Action getOutput()
        Control System chooses output between reactive layer and deliberative layer here. This is where Control System is able to choose which action between Reactive Layer and Deliberative Layer as the final output. Once chosen, the Model Layer will be updated with the action's movement direction.
        Returns:
